Text:
Sleepy Hillside gets +2 quest points for each resource token on it.
Response: After Sleepy Hillside becomes the active location, each player may choose to place 1 resource token on it to heal 1 damage from each hero they control.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

Text:
Tookland Tavern gets +2 quest points for each resource token on it.
Response: After Tookland Tavern becomes the active location, each player may choose to place 1 resource token on it to ready 1 character they control.

Perfect Smoke Spot gets +2 quest points for each resource token on it.
Response: After Perfect Smoke Spot becomes the active location, each player may choose to place 1 resource token on it to reduce their threat by 2.
Front.FlavorText:
They smoked in silence for a while, and the sun shone on them.
–The Two Towers

Text: When Revealed: Place 1 resource token on each Distracting location in play. Place 1 additional resource token on each Distracting location that is active. If no resource tokens were placed this way, We–ve Got Time! gains surge.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Either place 2 resource tokens on a Distracting location or attacking enemy gets +2 Attack.

Text: Forced: After Brandy-stream is explored, add it to the first player–s play area facedown. The next time an enemy attacks that player, deal this card to that enemy as an additional shadow card.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: After this attack, heal 1 damage from the defending character.

Text: Forced: After Buckland Homestead is explored, add it to the first player–s play area facedown. The next time an enemy attacks that player, deal this card to that enemy as an additional shadow card.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack for each shadow card dealt to it.

Text: Forced: After Watchful Wood is explored, add it to the first player–s play area facedown. The next time an enemy attacks that player, deal this card to that enemy as an additional shadow card.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each shadow card dealt to the attacking enemy.

Text: Forced: After Savage Pup attacks, if there is a shadow card dealt to it with no shadow effect, Savage Pup makes an additional attack. (Limit once per round.)
Front.FlavorText:
A wolf snapped at his cloak as he swung up, and nearly got him.
–The Hobbit

Text: Forced: After Scout Wolf attacks, if there is a shadow card dealt to it with the location card type, reveal that location. (Limit once per round.)
Front.FlavorText:
“How the wind howls!” he cried. “It is howling with wolf-voices.”
–Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: Forced: After Hunter Wolf attacks, if there is a shadow card dealt to it with the enemy card type, reveal that enemy. (Limit once per round.)
Front.FlavorText:
In a minute there was a whole pack of them yelping all round the tree and leaping up at the trunk, with eyes blazing and tongues hanging out.
–The Hobbit

Text: Damage dealt to Wolf enemies must be placed on a copy of Pack Defender first.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy has the Wolf trait, it cannot take damage until the end of the round.

Text: Forced: After Great Wolf attacks, if there is a shadow card dealt to it with the treachery card type, reveal that treachery. (Limit once per round.)
Front.FlavorText:
A shuddering howl broke from him, as if he were a captain summoning his pack to the assault.
–The Fellowship of the Ring

Text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot leave the staging area (except by being destroyed).
Other Wolf enemies get +1 Threat, +1 Attack and +1 Defense.
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if less than 5Per Player progress was placed on the main quest this phase, Packleader makes an immediate attack against each player in turn order.
Travel: Each player not engaged with a Wolf enemy must reveal the top card of the Wolf deck and engage it.
Front.FlavorText:
The woods on either side became denser; the trees were now younger and thicker; and as the lane went lower, running down into a fold of the hills, there were many deep brakes of hazel on the rising slopes at either hand.
–The Fellowship of the Ring

Text:
Locations in the staging area get ΓÇô1 Threat.
Forced: At the end of the round, trigger all Fowl effects. Flip this card over.
Front.FlavorText: Heads still pounding from last night–s revelry, your party sticks to their plan of setting out early. You grab the chickens and make your way towards Woody End with the sun ΓÇô of course ΓÇô in your eyes the whole trip.

Text: Forced: At the end of the round, trigger all Fowl effects. Place 1 resource token on Midday. Then, if there are 3 resource tokens on Midday, remove it from the game and add Sunset to the staging area.

Forced: At the end of the round, trigger all Fowl effects. Each player either raises their threat by 3 or reveals a card from the Wolf deck and engages it. Place 1 resource token on Sunset. Then, if there are 3 resource tokens on Sunset, remove them and flip this card over.

Forced: At the end of the round, trigger all Fowl effects. Each player must:
1. Raise their threat by 2. 2. For each Wolf enemy engaged with that player, deal 2 damage to a character they control. 3. Reveal a card from the Wolf deck and engage it.

Cannot have player card attachments.
Fowl: If the active location has the Distracting trait, place 1 resource token on it.
Front.FlavorText: Pig wanders here and there. As you make your way to Woodhall, you are unsure who is leading the way ΓÇô you or this rambling hen.

Text:
Cannot have player card attachments.
Fowl: Discard the top card of the Wolf deck. If it is a Savage Pup, put it into play engaged with you.
Front.FlavorText: Biddy clucks incessantly as you journey across the Shire. She seems to love the attention.

Text:
Cannot have player card attachments.
Fowl: Deal 1 damage to a character you control.
Front.FlavorText: Mertle has a wicked temperament. She scratches when she is picked up, she pecks when she is fed, and she seems to take deliberate pleasure in chasing the other chickens.

Text:
Cannot have player card attachments.
Fowl: If Morning or Midday is in play, reduce your threat by 1. If Sunset is in play, reduce your threat by 1 and exhaust another character you control. If Night is in play, exhaust another character you control.
Front.FlavorText: Edith is a sweet hen, easily the most placid of her flock.

Text:
When Duchess enters play, attach her to a hero you control. Restricted. Damage that would be dealt to Duchess is dealt to the attached hero instead.
Fowl: Name a card type and discard the top card of your deck. If it has the named type, add 1 resource to the attached hero–s resource pool.
Front.FlavorText: Duchess is known as the best egg-laying hen in the Shire. Passing folk often inquire if they can purchase her produce.

Text:
Cannot be optionally engaged. While Bloodfeather is in the staging area, he is considered to be engaged with each player.
Only Chicken characters can be declared as defenders against Bloodfeather.
Front.FlavorText: Old Farmer Chubb owns a rooster that is fierce beyond measure. Many locals have felt his peck and know him… as Bloodfeather.

Text: Forced: Damage dealt by Hungry Wolf must be placed on a Chicken objective you control, if able.
Front.FlavorText:
The howling of the wolves was now all round them, sometimes nearer, sometimes further off.
–The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: When Revealed: If Morning, Midday or Sunset is in play, trigger the Forced effect on the Time objective as if it were the end of the round. If Night is in play, –Short– Conversation gains surge and is added to the victory display.
Front.FlavorText:
“…so Mr. Frodo is his first and second cousin, once removed either way, as the saying is, if you follow me. And Mr. Drogo was staying at Brandy Hall with his father-in-law…”
–Gaffer Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring

Text: When Revealed: Reveal a card from the Wolf deck. Until the end of the phase, when you would reveal a card from the encounter deck, reveal a card from the Wolf deck instead. If Sunset or Night is in play, Sundown on the Shire gains surge.
When Revealed: Each player must choose: either discard the highest printed cost attachment you control or any 2 attachments you control.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character. If Night is in play, or if this attack is undefended, discard the attachment you control with the highest printed cost instead.

Text: When Revealed: The first player either exhausts a character they control, or deals 1 damage to a Chicken objective they control. If Sunset or Night is in play, do both and discard Sly Fox.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: If Sunset or Night is in play, deal 1 damage to a Chicken objective controlled by a player.

Text: When Revealed: Each player deals 2 damage to a character they control (3 damage instead if Sunset or Night is in play).
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Deal damage to attacking enemy equal to your Chicken objective–s Attack, if able.

Text: When Revealed: Choose a Wolf enemy engaged with a player and return it to the staging area. It makes an immediate attack against the first player and gets +2 Attack for this attack. If no attack was made this way, reveal the top card of the Wolf deck.
Front.Shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Attack (+2 Attack instead if Sunset or Night is in play).

Text: Setup: Create the Wolf deck (see rules). Each player takes control of a random Chicken objective. Set the other Chicken objectives, Packleader, Woody End, and Sunset aside, out of play. Add Morning to the staging area and choose when to leave: After Breakfast: Deal 1 damage to each hero and exhaust 1 hero each player controls. After Second Breakfast: Flip Morning to Midday. After Luncheon: Each player may trade their Chicken objective for another (either in play or set aside) and put a card in their hand into play. Flip Morning to Midday and place 1 resource token on it.

When Revealed: Each player discards cards from the encounter deck until a location is discarded and adds it to the staging area.
If Night is in play, or if a Chicken objective leaves play, the players lose the game.
Back.FlavorText: It is a beautiful day as you make your way to Woodhall. You aim to get there as quickly as possible, hopefully before nightfall.

Text: When Revealed: Add Woody End to the staging area. If there are 3 or more players in the game, search the encounter deck or discard pile for a copy of Watchful Wood and reveal it. If Sunset is in play, reveal 1Per Player cards from the Wolf deck.
Front.FlavorText: As you near the edge of Woody End, a few hobbits flag you down. “Please help us,” they beg. “Some woodcutters went missing last night, and we–re forming search parties to find them. We could use all the help we can get!” You glance at the sun above; you have some time to assist.

Text:
If a Chicken objective leaves play, the players lose the game.
The players cannot advance while Woody End is in play.
Back.FlavorText: You begin searching the woods for the missing hobbits. You think you may have found a trail of footprints, but there are other tracks nearby… wolf tracks.

Text: When Revealed: Each player reveals a card from the Wolf deck and puts it into play engaged with them. Add Packleader to the staging area.
Front.FlavorText: Deep in the heart of the woods, you meet a sad sight: the missing hobbits, laying dead in their ransacked campsite. “Who could have done this horrible thing?” one hero asks. As if in answer, a baleful howl pierces the quiet as many lupine shapes burst from the underbrush.

Text:
Packleader is considered engaged with the first player.
Forced: When a Chicken objective leaves play, remove it from the game and raise its controller–s threat by 3.
Forced: At the end of the round, if Packleader is in the victory display, the players win the game. Otherwise, advance to stage 4A.
Back.FlavorText: An enormous wolf emerges from the forest. By the way the other wolves fall into line behind it, you know this is their leader.

Text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Reveal 1Per Player cards from the Wolf deck.
Front.FlavorText: You hear more wolves coming from the forest. “There–s too many of them! We can–t possibly hope to fight them off!” one hero shouts. “Woodhall isn–t far from here. We must flee!”

Text:
X is 15Per Player. When you would reveal a card from the encounter deck, reveal a card from the Wolf deck instead.
Forced: When a Chicken objective leaves play, remove it from the game.
When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.
